truth.quote: Do what is right, not what is easy nor what is popular.
truth.author: Roy T. Bennett

truth.author: Pablo Picasso

truth.quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
truth.author: Henry David Thoreau

truth.quote: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
truth.author: Ernest Hemingway

truth.quote: The most important kind of freedom is to be what you really are. You trade in your reality for a role. You trade in your sense for an act. You give up your ability to feel, and in exchange, put on a mask. There can't be any large-scale revolution until there's a personal revolution, on an individual level. It's got to happen inside first.
truth.author: Jim MORRISON

truth.quote: The more I see, the less I know for sure.
truth.author: John Lennon

truth.quote: It's enough for me to be sure that you and I exist at this moment.
truth.author: Gabriel García Márquez

truth.quote: There are no facts, only interpretations.
truth.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

truth.quote: There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics.
truth.author: Benjamin Disraeli

truth.quote: All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know.
truth.author: Ernest Hemingway

truth.quote: So you're always honest," I said."Aren't you?"No," I told him. "I'm not."Well, that's good to know, I guess."I'm not saying I'm a liar," I told him. He raised his eyebrows. "That's not how I meant it, anyways."How'd you mean it, then?"I just...I don't always say what I feel."Why not?"Because the truth sometimes hurts," I said."Yeah," he said. "So do lies, though.
truth.author: Sarah Dessen

truth.quote: The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image. If in loving them we do not love what they are, but only their potential likeness to ourselves, then we do not love them: we only love the reflection of ourselves we find in them
truth.author: Thomas Merton

truth.quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.
truth.author: George Bernard Shaw

truth.quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
truth.author: Virginia Woolf

truth.quote: The past has no power over the present moment.
truth.author: Eckhart Tolle

truth.quote: A truth that's told with bad intentBeats all the lies you can invent.
truth.author: William Blake

truth.quote: No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong.
truth.author: François de La Rochefoucauld

truth.quote: I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.
truth.author: C. S. Lewis

truth.quote: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.
truth.author: Robert Orben

truth.quote: Thinking something does not make it true. Wanting something does not make it real.
truth.author: Michelle Hodkin

truth.quote: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
truth.author: Marcus Aurelius

truth.quote: Better a cruel truth than a comfortable delusion.
truth.author: Edward Abbey

truth.quote: The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.
truth.author: David Foster Wallace

truth.quote: To be fully seen by somebody, then, and be loved anyhow - this is a human offering that can border on miraculous.
truth.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

truth.quote: All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer.
truth.author: Ernest Hemingway

truth.quote: The only truth is music.
truth.author: Jack Kerouac

truth.quote: Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.
truth.author: George R.R. Martin

truth.quote: Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. "I'm okay" we say. "I'm alright". But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.
truth.author: Markus Zusak

truth.quote: Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand
truth.author: Hayley Williams

truth.quote: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
truth.author: George Washington

truth.quote: To teach how to live without certainty, and yet without being paralyzed by hesitation, is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy, in our age, can still do for those who study it.
truth.author: Bertrand Russell

truth.quote: It is truth that liberates, not your effort to be free.
truth.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

truth.quote: It’s strange how dreams get under your skin and give your heart a test for what’s real and what’s imaginary.
truth.author: Jason Mraz

truth.quote: Honest is how I want to look. The truth doesn't glitter and shine.
truth.author: Chuck Palahniuk

truth.quote: What I'm looking for is not out there, it is in me.
truth.author: Hellen Keller

truth.quote: To be great, be whole;Exclude nothing, exaggerate nothing that is not you.Be whole in everything. Put all you areInto the smallest thing you do.So, in each lake, the moon shines with splendorBecause it blooms up above.
truth.author: Fernando Pessoa

truth.quote: Either you repeat the same conventional doctrines everybody is saying, or else you say something true, and it will sound like it's from Neptune.
truth.author: Noam Chomsky

truth.quote: Time is precious, but truth is more precious than time.
truth.author: Benjamin Disraeli

truth.quote: Life is problems. Living is solving problems.
truth.author: Raymond E. Feist

truth.quote: Lies run sprints, but the truth runs marathons.
truth.author: Michael  Jackson

truth.quote: You have lost your reason and taken the wrong path. You have taken lies for truth, and hideousness for beauty. You would marvel if, owing to strange events of some sorts, frogs and lizards suddenly grew on apple and orange trees instead of fruit, or if roses began to smell like a sweating horse; so I marvel at you who exchange heaven for earth. I don't want to understand you.
truth.author: Anton Chekhov

truth.quote: If you believe what you like in the Gospel, and reject what you don't like, it is not the Gospel you believe, but yourself.
truth.author: Augustine

truth.quote: I examined the poets, and I look on them as people whose talent overawes both themselves and others, people who present themselves as wise men and are taken as such, when they are nothing of the sort.From poets, I moved to artists. No one was more ignorant about the arts than I; no one was more convinced that artists possessed really beautiful secrets. However, I noticed that their condition was no better than that of the poets and that both of them have the same misconceptions. Because the most skillful among them excel in their specialty, they look upon themselves as the wisest of men. In my eyes, this presumption completely tarnished their knowledge. As a result, putting myself in the place of the oracle and asking myself what I would prefer to be — what I was or what they were, to know what they have learned or to know that I know nothing — I replied to myself and to the god: I wish to remain who I am.We do not know — neither the sophists, nor the orators, nor the artists, nor I— what the True, the Good, and the Beautiful are. But there is this difference between us: although these people know nothing, they all believe they know something; whereas, I, if I know nothing, at least have no doubts about it. As a result, all this superiority in wisdom which the oracle has attributed to me reduces itself to the single point that I am strongly convinced that I am ignorant of what I do not know.
truth.author: Socrates

truth.quote: We all know that Art is not truth. Art is a lie that makes us realize truth at least the truth that is given us to understand. The artist must know the manner whereby to convince others of the truthfulness of his lies.
truth.author: Pablo Picasso

truth.quote: I ate civilization. It poisoned me; I was defiled. And then," he added in a lower tone, "I ate my own wickedness.
truth.author: Aldous Huxley

truth.quote: There are some things one remembers even though they may never have happened.
truth.author: Harold Pinter

truth.quote: An acquaintance merely enjoys your company, a fair-weather companion flatters when all is well, a true friend has your best interests at heart and the pluck to tell you what you need to hear.
truth.author: E.A. Bucchianeri

truth.quote: Sometimes what we want isn't what we need.
truth.author: Gena Showalter

truth.quote: Life is infinitely stranger than anything which the mind of man could invent.
truth.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

truth.quote: I was once reproved by a minister who was driving a poor beast to some meeting-house horse-sheds among the hills of New Hampshire, because I was bending my steps to a mountain-top on the Sabbath, instead of a church, when I would have gone farther than he to hear a true word spoken on that or any day. He declared that I was 'breaking the Lord's fourth commandment,' and proceeded to enumerate, in a sepulchral tone, the disasters which had befallen him whenever he had done any ordinary work on the Sabbath. He really thought that a god was on the watch to trip up those men who followed any secular work on this day, and did not see that it was the evil conscience of the workers that did it. The country is full of this superstition, so that when one enters a village, the church, not only really but from association, is the ugliest looking building in it, because it is the one in which human nature stoops the lowest and is most disgraced. Certainly, such temples as these shall erelong cease to deform the landscape. There are few things more disheartening and disgusting than when you are walking the streets of a strange village on the Sabbath, to hear a preacher shouting like a boatswain in a gale of wind, and thus harshly profaning the quiet atmosphere of the day.
truth.author: Henry David Thoreau

truth.quote: I'm not crying because of you; you're not worth it. I'm crying because my delusion of who you were was shattered by the truth of who you are.
truth.author: Steve Maraboli

truth.quote: Expectations make people miserable, so whatever yours are, lower them. You'll definitely be happier.
truth.author: Simone Elkeles

truth.quote: She has been to the compound before. She remembered this hallway. She knows about the initiation process. My mother was Dauntless.
truth.author: Veronica Roth

truth.quote: Enlightenment is man's release from his self-incurred tutelage. Tutelage is man's inability to make use of his understanding without direction from another. Self-incurred is this tutelage when its cause lies not in lack of reason but in lack of resolution and courage to use it without direction from another. Sapere aude! 'Have courage to use your own reason!'- that is the motto of enlightenment.
truth.author: Immanuel Kant

truth.quote: When no one you know tells the truth, you learn to see under the surface.
truth.author: Cassandra Clare

truth.quote: What an odd thing a diary is: the things you omit are more important than those you put in.
truth.author: Simone de Beauvoir

truth.quote: Along with the idea of romantic love, she was introduced to another--physical beauty. Probably the most destructive ideas in the history of human thought. Both originated in envy, thrived in insecurity, and ended in disillusion.
truth.author: Toni Morrison

truth.quote: At first, they'll only dislike what you say, but the more correct you start sounding the more they'll dislike you.
truth.author: Criss Jami

truth.quote: [Horror fiction] shows us that the control we believe we have is purely illusory, and that every moment we teeter on chaos and oblivion.
truth.author: Clive Barker

truth.quote: Convictions are more dangerous foes of truth than lies.
truth.author: Nietzsche

truth.quote: This above all: to thine own self be true.
truth.author: William Shakespeare

truth.quote: Like all dreamers I confuse disenchantment with truth.
truth.author: Jean Paul Sarte

truth.quote: I beg you, to have patience with everything unresolved in your heart and to try to love the questions themselves as if they were locked rooms or books written in a very foreign language. Don’t search for the answers, which could not be given to you now, because you would not be able to live them. And the point is to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps then, someday far in the future, you will gradually, without even noticing it, live your way into the answer.
truth.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

truth.quote: You think when you wake up in the mornin yesterday don't count. But yesterday is all that does count. What else is there? Your life is made out of the days it’s made out of. Nothin else.
truth.author: Cormac McCarthy

truth.quote: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and all science. He to whom this emotion is a stranger, who can no longer pause to wonder and stand rapt in awe, is as good as dead: his eyes are closed.
truth.author: Albert Einstein

truth.quote: We don't get to chose what is true. We only get to choose what we do about it.
truth.author: Kami Garcia

truth.quote: Trust starts with truth and ends with truth.
truth.author: Santosh Kalwar

truth.quote: Truth without love is brutality, and love without truth is hypocrisy.
truth.author: Warren Wiersbe

truth.quote: Real life's nasty. It's cruel. It doesn't care about heroes and happy endings and the way things should be. In real life, bad things happen. People die. Fights are lost. Evil often wins.
truth.author: Darren Shan

truth.quote: Death, taxes and childbirth! There's never any convenient time for any of them.
truth.author: Margaret Mitchell

truth.quote: My head’ll explode if I continue with this escapism.
truth.author: Jess C Scott

truth.quote: Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized.
truth.author: Osho

truth.quote: If you give up what you want most for what you think you should want more, you'll end up miserable.
truth.author: Brandon Sanderson

truth.quote: Truth is on the side of the oppressed.
truth.author: Malcolm X

truth.quote: That sometimes human beings have to just sit in one place and, like, hurt. That you will become way less concerned with what other people think of you when you realize how seldom they do. That there is such a thing as raw, unalloyed, agendaless kindness. That it is possible to fall asleep during an anxiety attack. That concentrating on anything is very hard work.
truth.author: David Foster Wallace

truth.quote: I guess sometimes you have to lie to find the truth.
truth.author: Scott Westerfield

truth.quote: I'm guilty of giving people more chances than they deserve but when I'm done, I'm done.
truth.author: Turcois Ominek

truth.quote: The forceps of our minds are clumsy forceps, and crush the truth a little in taking hold of it.
truth.author: H.G. Wells

truth.quote: Beauty is truth, truth beauty,—that is all Ye know on earth, and all ye need to know
truth.author: John Keats

truth.quote: He moved like a dancer, which is not surprising; a horse is a beautiful animal, but it is perhaps most remarkable because it moves as if it always hears music.
truth.author: Mark Helprin

truth.quote: Stop doing what is easy or popular. Start doing what is right.
truth.author: Roy T. Bennett

truth.quote: Conquer the angry one by not getting angry; conquer the wicked by goodness; conquer the stingy by generosity, and the liar by speaking the truth.[Verse 223]
truth.author: Siddhārtha Gautama

truth.quote: I will no longer mutilate and destroy myself in order to find a secret behind the ruins.
truth.author: Hermann Hesse

truth.quote: Religious doctrines … are all illusions, they do not admit of proof, and no one can be compelled to consider them as true or to believe in them.
truth.author: Sigmund Freud

truth.quote: I love the stars.Because they can't say anything.I love the stars.Because they do not judge anyone.
truth.author: Natsuki Takaya

truth.quote: The truth is messy. It's raw and uncomfortable. You can't blame people for preferring lies.
truth.author: Holly Black

truth.quote: What the hell is instant? Nothing is instant. Instant rice takes five minutes, instant pudding an hour. I doubt that an instant of blinding pain feels particularly instantaneous.
truth.author: John Green

truth.quote: You should not honor men more than truth.
truth.author: Plato

truth.quote: The ideals which have always shone before me and filled me with joy are goodness, beauty, and truth.
truth.author: Albert Einstein

truth.quote: The truth is always an insult or a joke, lies are generally tastier. We love them. The nature of lies is to please. Truth has no concern for anyone's comfort
truth.author: Katherine Dunn

truth.quote: I was going to die, sooner or later, whether or not I had even spoken myself. My silences had not protected me. Your silences will not protect you.... What are the words you do not yet have? What are the tyrannies you swallow day by day and attempt to make your own, until you will sicken and die of them, still in silence? We have been socialized to respect fear more than our own need for language."I began to ask each time: "What's the worst that could happen to me if I tell this truth?" Unlike women in other countries, our breaking silence is unlikely to have us jailed, "disappeared" or run off the road at night. Our speaking out will irritate some people, get us called bitchy or hypersensitive and disrupt some dinner parties. And then our speaking out will permit other women to speak, until laws are changed and lives are saved and the world is altered forever.Next time, ask: What's the worst that will happen? Then push yourself a little further than you dare. Once you start to speak, people will yell at you. They will interrupt you, put you down and suggest it's personal. And the world won't end.And the speaking will get easier and easier. And you will find you have fallen in love with your own vision, which you may never have realized you had. And you will lose some friends and lovers, and realize you don't miss them. And new ones will find you and cherish you. And you will still flirt and paint your nails, dress up and party, because, as I think Emma Goldman said, "If I can't dance, I don't want to be part of your revolution." And at last you'll know with surpassing certainty that only one thing is more frightening than speaking your truth. And that is not speaking.
truth.author: Audre Lorde

truth.quote: There is no greatness where there is not simplicity, goodness, and truth.
truth.author: Leo Tolstoy

truth.quote: There is nothing that is going to make people hate you more, and love you more, than telling the truth.
truth.author: Stefan Molyneux

truth.quote: I quote others only in order the better to express myself.
truth.author: Michel de Montaigne

truth.quote: Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about its own things. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble. Matthew 6:34
truth.author: Anonymous

truth.quote: I’m not sure. But there’s something about the darkness, the stillness of this hour, I think, that creates a language of its own. There’s a strange kind of freedom in the dark; a terrifying vulnerability we allow ourselves at exactly the wrong moment, tricked by the darkness into thinking it will keep our secrets. We forget that the blackness is not a blanket; we forget that the sun will soon rise. But in the moment, at least, we feel brave enough to say things we’d never say in the light.
truth.author: Tahereh Mafi

truth.quote: Muhammad has always been standing higher than the Christianity. He does not consider god as a human being and never makes himself equal to God. Muslims worship nothing except God and Muhammad is his Messenger. There is no any mystery and secret in it.
truth.author: Leo Tolstoy

truth.quote: Nothing is ever certain.
truth.author: Alice Sebold

truth.quote: What's done cannot be undone.
truth.author: William Shakespeare

truth.quote: The most fundamental aggression to ourselves, the most fundamental harm we can do to ourselves, is to remain ignorant by not having the courage and the respect to look at ourselves honestly and gently.
truth.author: Pema Chödrön

truth.quote: What comes into our minds when we think about God is the most important thing about us.
truth.author: A.W. Tozer

truth.quote: With a secret like that, at some point the secret itself becomes irrelevant. The fact that you kept it does not.
truth.author: Sara Gruen

truth.quote: In a room wherepeople unanimously maintaina conspiracy of silence,one word of truthsounds like a pistol shot.
truth.author: Czesław Miłosz

truth.quote: There is no doubt fiction makes a better job of the truth.
truth.author: Doris May Lessing

truth.quote: You’re not obligated to win. You’re obligated to keep trying. To the best you can do everyday.
truth.author: Jason Mraz

truth.quote: A thing may happen and be a total lie; another thing may not happen and be truer than the truth.
truth.author: Tim O'Brien

truth.quote: Mistakes are, after all, the foundations of truth, and if a man does not know what a thing is, it is at least an increase in knowledge if he knows what it is not.
truth.author: Carl G. Jung

truth.quote: Knowing can be a curse on a person's life. I'd traded in a pack of lies for a pack of truth, and I didn't know which one was heavier. Which one took the most strength to carry around? It was a ridiculous question, though, because once you know the truth, you can't ever go back and pick up your suitcase of lies. Heavier or not, the truth is yours now.
truth.author: Sue Monk Kidd

truth.quote: When you cut pieces out of the truth to avoid looking like a fool you end up looking like a moron instead.
truth.author: Robin Hobb

truth.quote: Art should comfort the disturbed and disturb the comfortable.
truth.author: Banksy

truth.quote: Cherish those who seek the truth but beware of those who find it.
truth.author: Voltaire

truth.quote: Every person must choose how much truth he can stand.
truth.author: Irvin D. Yalom

truth.quote: The truth is not for all men but only for those who seek it.
truth.author: Ayn Rand

truth.quote: Don't assume, ask. Be kind. Tell the truth. Don't say anything you can't stand behind fully. Have integrity. Tell people how you feel.
truth.author: Warsan Shire

truth.quote: May Light always surround you;Hope kindle and rebound you.May your Hurts turn to Healing;Your Heart embrace Feeling.May Wounds become Wisdom;Every Kindness a Prism.May Laughter infect you;Your Passion resurrect you.May Goodness inspire your Deepest Desires.Through all that you Reach For, May your arms Never Tire.
truth.author: D. Simone

truth.quote: There is beauty in truth, even if it's painful. Those who lie, twist life so that it looks tasty to the lazy, brilliant to the ignorant, and powerful to the weak. But lies only strengthen our defects. They don't teach anything, help anything, fix anything or cure anything. Nor do they develop one's character, one's mind, one's heart or one's soul.
truth.author: José N. Harris

truth.quote: Nothing is real.
truth.author: John Lennon

truth.quote: V-Day…if you need this one day in a year to show everyone else you truly care for "your loved one" I think it’s quite stupid. I hate this commercialism. It’s all artificial, and has nothing to do with real love.
truth.author: Jess C Scott

truth.quote: For everything in this journey of life we are on, there is a right wing and a left wing: for the wing of love there is anger; for the wing of destiny there is fear; for the wing of pain there is healing; for the wing of hurt there is forgiveness; for the wing of pride there is humility; for the wing of giving there is taking; for the wing of tears there is joy; for the wing of rejection there is acceptance; for the wing of judgment there is grace; for the wing of honor there is shame; for the wing of letting go there is the wing of keeping. We can only fly with two wings and two wings can only stay in the air if there is a balance. Two beautiful wings is perfection. There is a generation of people who idealize perfection as the existence of only one of these wings every time. But I see that a bird with one wing is imperfect. An angel with one wing is imperfect. A butterfly with one wing is dead. So this generation of people strive to always cut off the other wing in the hopes of embodying their ideal of perfection, and in doing so, have created a crippled race.
truth.author: C. JoyBell C.

truth.quote: Sometimes people think they know you. They know a few facts about you, and they piece you together in a way that makes sense to them. And if you don't know yourself very well, you might even believe that they are right. But the truth is, that isn't you. That isn't you at all.
truth.author: Leila Sales

truth.quote: The truth is, everyone likes to look down on someone. If your favorites are all avant-garde writers who throw in Sanskrit and German, you can look down on everyone. If your favorites are all Oprah Book Club books, you can at least look down on mystery readers. Mystery readers have sci-fi readers. Sci-fi can look down on fantasy. And yes, fantasy readers have their own snobbishness. I’ll bet this, though: in a hundred years, people will be writing a lot more dissertations on Harry Potter than on John Updike. Look, Charles Dickens wrote popular fiction. Shakespeare wrote popular fiction—until he wrote his sonnets, desperate to show the literati of his day that he was real artist. Edgar Allan Poe tied himself in knots because no one realized he was a genius. The core of the problem is how we want to define "literature". The Latin root simply means "letters". Those letters are either delivered—they connect with an audience—or they don’t. For some, that audience is a few thousand college professors and some critics. For others, its twenty million women desperate for romance in their lives. Those connections happen because the books successfully communicate something real about the human experience. Sure, there are trashy books that do really well, but that’s because there are trashy facets of humanity. What people value in their books—and thus what they count as literature—really tells you more about them than it does about the book.
truth.author: Brent weeks

truth.quote: Transformation is my favorite game and in my experience, anger and frustration are the result of you not being authentic somewhere in your life or with someone in your life. Being fake about anything creates a block inside of you. Life can’t work for you if you don’t show up as you.
truth.author: Jason Mraz

truth.quote: The opposite of a correct statement is a false statement. But the opposite of a profound truth may well be another profound truth.
truth.author: Niels Bohr

truth.quote: I do not know what I may appear to the world, but to myself I seem to have been only like a boy playing on the sea-shore, and diverting myself in now and then finding a smoother pebble or a prettier shell than ordinary, whilst the great ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me.
truth.author: Isaac Newton

truth.quote: Simple can be harder than complex: You have to work hard to get your thinking clean to make it simple. But it’s worth it in the end because once you get there, you can move mountains.
truth.author: Steve Jobs

truth.quote: You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you odd.
truth.author: Flannery O'Connor

truth.quote: You should never read just for "enjoyment." Read to make yourself smarter! Less judgmental. More apt to understand your friends' insane behavior, or better yet, your own. Pick "hard books." Ones you have to concentrate on while reading. And for god's sake, don't let me ever hear you say, "I can't read fiction. I only have time for the truth." Fiction is the truth, fool! Ever hear of "literature"? That means fiction, too, stupid.
truth.author: John Waters

truth.quote: I think it's impossible to really understand somebody, what they want, what they believe, and not love them the way they love themselves.
truth.author: Orson Scott Card

truth.quote: I wondered how many people there were in the world who suffered, and continued to suffer, because they could not break out from their own web of shyness and reserve, and in their blindness and folly built up a great distorted wall in front of them that hid the truth.
truth.author: Daphne du Maurier

truth.quote: Does truth have a moral?
truth.author: Rick Riordan

truth.quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.
truth.author: René Descartes

truth.quote: I’ve come to the conclusion that people who wear headphones while they walk, are much happier, more confident, and more beautiful individuals than someone making the solitary drudge to work without acknowledging their own interests and power.
truth.author: Jason Mraz

truth.quote: Vulnerability sounds like truth and feels like courage. Truth and courage aren't always comfortable, but they're never weakness.
truth.author: Brené Brown

truth.quote: The truth knocks on the door and you say, "Go away, I'm looking for the truth," and so it goes away. Puzzling.
truth.author: Robert M. Pirsig

truth.quote: Do you really believe ... that everything historians tell us about men – or about women – is actually true? You ought to consider the fact that these histories have been written by men, who never tell the truth except by accident.
truth.author: Moderata Fonte

truth.quote: Better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie.
truth.author: Khaled Hosseini

truth.quote: The high-minded man must care more for the truth than for what people think.
truth.author: Aristotle

truth.quote: Prediction is very difficult, especially about the future.
truth.author: Niels Bohr

truth.quote: Somehow, we'll find it. The balance between whom we wish to be and whom we need to be. But for now, we simply have to be satisfied with who we are.
truth.author: Brandon Sanderson

truth.quote: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you.
truth.author: Hemingway Ernest

truth.quote: Wait a second," Four says. I turn toward him, wondering which version of Four I'll see now-the one who scolds me, or the one who climbs Ferris wheels with me. He smiles a little, but the smile doesn't spread to his eyes, which look less tense and worried."You belong here, you know that?" he says. "You belong with us. It'll be over soon, so just hold on, okay?"He scratches behind his ear and looks away, like he's embarrassed by what he said. I stare at him. I feel my heartbeat everywhere, even in my toes. I feel like doing something bold, but I could just as easily walk away. I am not sure which option is smarter, or better. I am not sure that I care.I reach out and take his hand. His fingers slide between mine. I can't breathe. I stare up at him, and he stares down at me. For a long moment, we stay that way. Then I pull my hand away and run after Uriah and Lynn and Marlene. Maybe now he thinks I'm stupid, or strange. Maybe it was worth it.
truth.author: Veronica Roth

truth.quote: On some positions, cowardice asks the question, is it expedient? And then expedience comes along and asks the question, is it politic? Vanity asks the question, is it popular? Conscience asks the question, is it right?There comes a time when one must take the position that is neither safe nor politic nor popular, but he must do it because conscience tells him it is right.
truth.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

truth.quote: The most perfidious way of harming a cause consists of defending it deliberately with faulty arguments.
truth.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

truth.quote: The tyrant dies and his rule is over, the martyr dies and his rule begins.
truth.author: Soren Kierkegaard

truth.quote: The time will come when diligent research over long periods will bring to light things which now lie hidden. A single lifetime, even though entirely devoted to the sky, would not be enough for the investigation of so vast a subject... And so this knowledge will be unfolded only through long successive ages. There will come a time when our descendants will be amazed that we did not know things that are so plain to them... Many discoveries are reserved for ages still to come, when memory of us will have been effaced.
truth.author: Seneca

truth.quote: There are few reasons for telling the truth, but for lying the number is infinite.
truth.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

truth.quote: Sometimes people don’t understandthe promises they’re making when they make them," I said.Isaac shot me a look. "Right, of course.But you keep the promise anyway. That’swhat love is. Love is keeping the promise anyway. Don’t you believe in true love?
truth.author: John Green

truth.quote: Truth is like the sun. You can shut it out for a time, but it ain't going away.
truth.author: Elvis Presley

truth.quote: Stop doing what is easy. Start doing what is right.
truth.author: Roy T. Bennett

truth.quote: There is no escape—we pay for the violence of our ancestors.
truth.author: Frank Herbert

truth.quote: 1492. As children we were taught to memorize this year with pride and joy as the year people began living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America. Actually, people had been living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America for hundreds of years before that. 1492 was simply the year sea pirates began to rob, cheat, and kill them.
truth.author: Kurt Vonnegut

truth.quote: Truth never damages a cause that is just.
truth.author: Mahatma Gandhi

truth.quote: Wrong does not cease to be wrong because the majority share in it.
truth.author: Leo Tolstoy

truth.quote: Life's as kind as you let it be.
truth.author: Charles Bukowski

truth.quote: It is always the false that makes you suffer, the false desires and fears, the false values and ideas, the false relationships between people. Abandon the false and you are free of pain; truth makes happy, truth liberates.
truth.author: Sri Nisargadatta Maharaj

truth.quote: The most common form of despair is not being who you are.
truth.author: Søren Kierkegaard

truth.quote: Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures.
truth.author: Jessamyn West

truth.quote: Being in a minority, even in a minority of one, did not make you mad. There was truth and there was untruth, and if you clung to the truth even against the whole world, you were not mad.
truth.author: George Orwell

truth.quote: Love truth, but pardon error.
truth.author: Voltaire

truth.quote: Who is more humble? The scientist who looks at the universe with an open mind and accepts whatever the universe has to teach us, or somebody who says everything in this book must be considered the literal truth and never mind the fallibility of all the human beings involved?
truth.author: Carl Sagan

truth.quote: I envy people that know love. That have someone who takes them as they are.
truth.author: Jess C Scott

truth.quote: Three things can not hide for long: the Moon, the Sun and the Truth.
truth.author: Gautama Buddha

truth.quote: But when it came right down to it, the skin of my wrist looked so white and defensless that I couldn't do it. It was as if what I wanted to kill wasn't in that skin or the thin blue pulse that jumped under my thumb, but somewhere else, deeper, more secret, and a whole lot harder to get.
truth.author: Sylvia Plath

truth.quote: Friends are the family you choose (~ Nin/Ithilnin, Elven rogue).
truth.author: Jess C Scott

truth.quote: If the road is easy, you're likely going the wrong way.
truth.author: Terry Goodkind

truth.quote: Equality is not a concept. It's not something we should be striving for. It's a necessity. Equality is like gravity. We need it to stand on this earth as men and women, and the misogyny that is in every culture is not a true part of the human condition. It is life out of balance, and that imbalance is sucking something out of the soul of every man and woman who's confronted with it. We need equality. Kinda now.
truth.author: Joss Whedon

truth.quote: There's more beauty in truth, even if it is dreadful beauty.
truth.author: John Steinbeck

truth.quote: The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection.
truth.author: George Orwell

truth.quote: It is an occupational hazard that anyone who has spent her life learning how to lie eventually becomes bad at telling the truth.
truth.author: Ally Carter

truth.quote: Facts are like cows. If you look them in the face long enough, they generally run away.
truth.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

truth.quote: When truth is replaced by silence,the silence is a lie.
truth.author: Yevgeny Yevtushenko

truth.quote: One should never trust a woman who tells one her real age. A woman who would tell one that would tell one anything.
truth.author: Oscar Wilde

truth.quote: The best lies were always mixed with truth.
truth.author: Sarah J. Maas

truth.quote: Here's something else to think about: calling when you say you're going to is the very first brick in the house you are building of love and trust. If he can't lay this one stupid brick down, you ain't never gonna have a house baby, and it's cold outside.
truth.author: Greg Behrendt

truth.quote: Over the years, I have come to realize that the greatest trap in our life is not success, popularity, or power, but self-rejection. Success, popularity, and power can indeed present a great temptation, but their seductive quality often comes from the way they are part of the much larger temptation to self-rejection. When we have come to believe in the voices that call us worthless and unlovable, then success, popularity, and power are easily perceived as attractive solutions. The real trap, however, is self-rejection. As soon as someone accuses me or criticizes me, as soon as I am rejected, left alone, or abandoned, I find myself thinking, "Well, that proves once again that I am a nobody." ... [My dark side says,] I am no good... I deserve to be pushed aside, forgotten, rejected, and abandoned. Self-rejection is the greatest enemy of the spiritual life because it contradicts the sacred voice that calls us the "Beloved." Being the Beloved constitutes the core truth of our existence.
truth.author: Henri J.M. Nouwen

truth.quote: But you can't make people listen. They have to come round in their own time, wondering what happened and why the world blew up around them. It can't last.
truth.author: Ray Bradbury

truth.quote: Things come apart so easily when they have been held together with lies.
truth.author: Dorothy Allison

truth.quote: You never know how much you really believe anything until its truth or falsehood becomes a matter of life and death to you.
truth.author: C.S. Lewis

truth.quote: Words can be twisted into any shape. Promises can be made to lull the heart and seduce the soul. In the final analysis, words mean nothing. They are labels we give things in an effort to wrap our puny little brains around their underlying natures, when ninety-nine percent of the time the totality of the reality is an entirely different beast. The wisest man is the silent one. Examine his actions. Judge him by them.
truth.author: Karen Marie Moning

truth.quote: Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.
truth.author: Andre Gide

truth.quote: Let’s start with this statistic: You are delicious. Be brave, my sweet. I know you can get lonely. I know you can crave companionship and sex and love so badly that it physically hurts. But I truly believe that the only way you can find out that there’s something better out there is to first believe there’s something better out there. What other choice is there?
truth.author: Greg Behrendt

truth.quote: The only way you can write the truth is to assume that what you set down will never be read. Not by any other person, and not even by yourself at some later date. Otherwise you begin excusing yourself. You must see the writing as emerging like a long scroll of ink from the index finger of your right hand; you must see your left hand erasing it.
truth.author: Margaret Atwood

truth.quote: History, Stephen said, is a nightmare from which I am trying to awake.
truth.author: James Joyce

truth.quote: Live your truth. Express your love. Share your enthusiasm. Take action towards your dreams. Walk your talk. Dance and sing to your music. Embrace your blessings. Make today worth remembering.
truth.author: Steve Maraboli

truth.quote: The truth doesn't always set you free; people prefer to believe prettier, neatley wrapped lies
truth.author: Jodi Picoult

truth.quote: Seldom, very seldom, does complete truth belong to any human disclosure; seldom can it happen that something is not a little disguised or a little mistaken.
truth.author: Jane Austen

truth.quote: If someone is able to show me that what I think or do is not right, I will happily change, for I seek the truth, by which no one was ever truly harmed. It is the person who continues in his self-deception and ignorance who is harmed.
truth.author: Marcus Aurelius

truth.quote: I am not bound to win, but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live up to what light I have.
truth.author: Abraham Lincoln

truth.quote: One swing set, well worn but structurally sound, seeks new home. Make memories with your kid or kids so that someday he or she or they will look into the backyard and feel the ache of sentimentality as desperately as I did this afternoon. It's all fragile and fleeting, dear reader, but with this swing set, your child(ren) will be introduced to the ups and downs of human life gently and safely, and may also learn the most important lesson of all: No matter how hard you kick, no matter how high you get, you can't go all the way around.
truth.author: John Green

truth.quote: Wanting to be liked can get in the way of truth.
truth.author: Delia Ephron

truth.quote: A fit, healthy body—that is the best fashion statement
truth.author: Jess C Scott

truth.quote: I can't believe I said it out loud. The truth doesn't set you free, you know. It makes you feel awkward and embarrassed and defenseless and red in the face and horrified and petrified and vulnerable. But free? I don't feel free. I feel like shit.
truth.author: Melina Marchetta

truth.quote: Oh, what a tangled web we weave...when first we practice to deceive.
truth.author: Walter Scott

truth.quote: I have survived. I am here. Confused, screwed up, but here. So, how can I find my way? Is there a chain saw of the soul, an ax I can take to my memories or fears?
truth.author: Laurie Halse Anderson

truth.quote: I believe that truth has only one face: that of a violent contradiction.
truth.author: Georges Bataille

truth.quote: The Bible has noble poetry in it... and some good morals and a wealth of obscenity, and upwards of a thousand lies.
truth.author: Mark Twain

truth.quote: Seeking what is true is not seeking what is desirable.
truth.author: Albert Camus

truth.quote: Boredom: the desire for desires.
truth.author: Leo Tolstoy

truth.quote: Anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job.
truth.author: Douglas Adams

truth.quote: Never hide things from hardcore thinkers. They get more aggravated, more provoked by confusion than the most painful truths.
truth.author: Criss Jami

truth.quote: I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the Heart's affections and the truth of the Imagination.
truth.author: John Keats

truth.quote: Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.
truth.author: Henry David Thoreau

truth.quote: A man's true character comes out when he's drunk.
truth.author: Charlie Chaplin

truth.quote: I have a theory that the truth is never told during the nine-to-five hours.
truth.author: Hunter S. Thompson

truth.quote: You may choose to look the other way but you can never say again that you did not know.
truth.author: William Wilberforce

truth.quote: Man is always prey to his truths. Once he has admitted them, he cannot free himself from them.
truth.author: Albert Camus

truth.quote: I felt like an animal, and animals don’t know sin, do they?
truth.author: Jess C. Scott

truth.quote: How hurtful it can be to deny one's true self and live a life of lies just to appease others.
truth.author: June Ahern

truth.quote: It is an illusion that youth is happy, an illusion of those who have lost it; but the young know they are wretched for they are full of the truthless ideal which have been instilled into them, and each time they come in contact with the real, they are bruised and wounded. It looks as if they were victims of a conspiracy; for the books they read, ideal by the necessity of selection, and the conversation of their elders, who look back upon the past through a rosy haze of forgetfulness, prepare them for an unreal life. They must discover for themselves that all they have read and all they have been told are lies, lies, lies; and each discovery is another nail driven into the body on the cross of life.
truth.author: W. Somerset Maugham

truth.quote: You don’t believe things because they make your life better, you believe them because they’re true.
truth.author: Veronica Roth

truth.quote: I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best.
truth.author: Marilyn Monroe

truth.quote: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
truth.author: Mark Twain

truth.quote: The reason I talk to myself is because I’m the only one whose answers I accept.
truth.author: George Carlin

truth.quote: When someone loves you, the way they talk about you is different. You feel safe and comfortable.
truth.author: Jess C. Scott

truth.quote: The truth." Dumbledore sighed. "It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution.
truth.author: J.K. Rowling

truth.quote: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
truth.author: Oscar Wilde

truth.quote: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
truth.author: Mark Twain

truth.quote: Never tell the truth to people who are not worthy of it.
truth.author: Mark Twain

truth.quote: Perhaps one did not want to be loved so much as to be understood.
truth.author: George Orwell

truth.quote: The truth will set you free, but first it will piss you off.
truth.author: Joe Klaas

truth.quote: When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always.
truth.author: Mahatma Gandhi

truth.quote: I am not pretty. I am not beautiful. I am as radiant as the sun.
truth.author: Suzanne Collins

truth.quote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
truth.author: Aldous Huxley

truth.quote: Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love.
truth.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

truth.quote: I believe in everything until it's disproved. So I believe in fairies, the myths, dragons. It all exists, even if it's in your mind. Who's to say that dreams and nightmares aren't as real as the here and now?
truth.author: John Lennon

truth.quote: In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act.
truth.author: George Orwell

truth.quote: A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it.
truth.author: Oscar Wilde

truth.quote: Here's all you have to know about men and women: women are crazy, men are stupid. And the main reason women are crazy is that men are stupid.
truth.author: George Carlin

truth.quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
truth.author: Socrates

truth.quote: Books are mirrors: you only see in them what you already have inside you.
truth.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

truth.quote: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
truth.author: Oscar Wilde

truth.quote: Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing had happened.
truth.author: Winston S. Churchill

truth.quote: Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed. If people all over the world...would do this, it would change the earth.
truth.author: William Faulkner

truth.quote: I lie to myself all the time. But I never believe me.
truth.author: S.E. Hinton

truth.quote: Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't.
truth.author: Mark Twain

truth.quote: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.
truth.author: Flannery O'Connor

truth.quote: The truth is, unless you let go, unless you forgive yourself, unless you forgive the situation, unless you realize that the situation is over, you cannot move forward.
truth.author: Steve Maraboli

truth.quote: Be mindful. Be grateful. Be positive. Be true. Be kind.
truth.author: Roy T. Bennett

truth.quote: Tell the truth, or someone will tell it for you.
truth.author: Stephanie Klein

truth.quote: The things you do for yourself are gone when you are gone, but the things you do for others remain as your legacy.
truth.author: Kalu Ndukwe Kalu

truth.quote: That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth.
truth.author: Tim O'Brien

truth.quote: It is difficult, when faced with a situation you cannot control, to admit you can do nothing.
truth.author: Lemony Snicket

truth.quote: All right," said Susan. "I'm not stupid. You're saying humans need... fantasies to make life bearable."REALLY? AS IF IT WAS SOME KIND OF PINK PILL? NO. HUMANS NEED FANTASY TO BE HUMAN. TO BE THE PLACE WHERE THE FALLING ANGEL MEETS THE RISING APE."Tooth fairies? Hogfathers? Little—"YES. AS PRACTICE. YOU HAVE TO START OUT LEARNING TO BELIEVE THE LITTLE LIES."So we can believe the big ones?"YES. JUSTICE. MERCY. DUTY. THAT SORT OF THING."They're not the same at all!"YOU THINK SO? THEN TAKE THE UNIVERSE AND GRIND IT DOWN TO THE FINEST POWDER AND SIEVE IT THROUGH THE FINEST SIEVE AND THEN SHOW ME ONE ATOM OF JUSTICE, ONE MOLECULE OF MERCY. AND YET—Death waved a hand. AND YET YOU ACT AS IF THERE IS SOME IDEAL ORDER IN THE WORLD, AS IF THERE IS SOME...SOME RIGHTNESS IN THE UNIVERSE BY WHICH IT MAY BE JUDGED."Yes, but people have got to believe that, or what's the point—"MY POINT EXACTLY.
truth.author: Terry Pratchett

truth.quote: When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.
truth.author: Kahlil Gibran

truth.quote: I'm about to make a wild, extreme and severe relationship rule: the word busy is a load of crap and is most often used by assholes. The word "busy" is the relationship Weapon of Mass Destruction. It seems like a good excuse, but in fact in every silo you uncover, all you're going to find is a man who didn't care enough to call. Remember men are never to busy to get what they want.
truth.author: Greg Behrendt

truth.quote: There are times to stay put, and what you want will come to you, and there are times to go out into the world and find such a thing for yourself.
truth.author: Lemony Snicket

truth.quote: People often claim to hunger for truth, but seldom like the taste when it's served up.
truth.author: George R.R. Martin

truth.quote: I'm for truth, no matter who tells it. I'm for justice, no matter who it is for or against. I'm a human being, first and foremost, and as such I'm for whoever and whatever benefits humanity as a whole.
truth.author: Malcolm X

truth.quote: People think that a liar gains a victory over his victim. What I’ve learned is that a lie is an act of self-abdication, because one surrenders one’s reality to the person to whom one lies, making that person one’s master, condemning oneself from then on to faking the sort of reality that person’s view requires to be faked…The man who lies to the world, is the world’s slave from then on…There are no white lies, there is only the blackest of destruction, and a white lie is the blackest of all.
truth.author: Ayn Rand

truth.quote: The truth isn't always beauty, but the hunger for it is.
truth.author: Nadine Gordimer

truth.quote: Much of what was said did not matter, and that much of what mattered could not be said.
truth.author: Katherine Boo

truth.quote: The truth is not always beautiful, nor beautiful words the truth.
truth.author: Lao Tzu

truth.quote: We live in an age when unnecessary things are our only necessities.
truth.author: Oscar Wilde

truth.quote: Men may be stronger, but it is women who endure.
truth.author: Cassandra Clare

truth.quote: You can safely assume you've created God in your own image when it turns out that God hates all the same people you do.
truth.author: Anne Lamott

truth.quote: There’s no such thing as ruining your life. Life’s a pretty resilient thing, it turns out.
truth.author: Sophie Kinsella

truth.quote: A thinker sees his own actions as experiments and questions--as attempts to find out something. Success and failure are for him answers above all.
truth.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

truth.quote: There are two ways to be fooled. One is to believe what isn't true; the other is to refuse to believe what is true.
truth.author: Soren Kierkegaard

truth.quote: If you look for truth, you may find comfort in the end; if you look for comfort you will not get either comfort or truth only soft soap and wishful thinking to begin, and in the end, despair.
truth.author: C.S. Lewis

truth.quote: Just because you don't understand it doesn't mean it isn't so.
truth.author: Lemony Snicket

truth.quote: I think that we are like stars. Something happens to burst us open; but when we burst open and think we are dying; we’re actually turning into a supernova. And then when we look at ourselves again, we see that we’re suddenly more beautiful than we ever were before!
truth.author: C. JoyBell C.

truth.quote: Sometimes things become possible if we want them bad enough.
truth.author: T.S. Eliot

truth.quote: For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring.
truth.author: Carl Sagan

truth.quote: Something inside Clary cracked and broke, and words came pouring out. 'What do you want me to tell you? The truth? The truth is that I love Simon like I should love you, and I wish he was my brother and you weren't, but I can't do anything about that and neither can you!
truth.author: Cassandra Clare

truth.quote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
truth.author: Walt Whitman

truth.quote: Those sweet lips. My, oh my, I could kiss those lips all night long.Good things come to those who wait.
truth.author: Jess C. Scott

truth.quote: Nothing ever happens like you imagine it will
truth.author: John Green

truth.quote: I’m just sick of ego, ego, ego. My own and everybody else’s. I’m sick of everybody that wants to get somewhere, do something distinguished and all, be somebody interesting. It’s disgusting.
truth.author: J.D. Salinger

truth.quote: Perhaps the truth depends on a walk around the lake.
truth.author: Wallace Stevens

truth.quote: There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure truth.
truth.author: Maya Angelou

truth.quote: The laughter of the world is merely loneliness pathetically trying to reassure itself.
truth.author: Neal A. Maxwell

truth.quote: The truth may be out there, but the lies are inside your head.
truth.author: Terry Pratchett

truth.quote: Truth would quickly cease to be stranger than fiction, once we got as used to it.
truth.author: H. L. Mencken

truth.quote: Beloved, let us love one another, because love is from God; everyone one who loves is born of God and knows God. Whoever does not love does not know God, for God is love.
truth.author: Anonymous

truth.quote: Gossip, as usual, was one-third right and two-thirds wrong.
truth.author: L.M. Montgomery

truth.quote: To know and not to know, to be conscious of complete truthfulness while telling carefully constructed lies, to hold simultaneously two opinions which cancelled out, knowing them to be contradictory and believing in both of them, to use logic against logic, to repudiate morality while laying claim to it, to believe that democracy was impossible and that the Party was the guardian of democracy, to forget whatever it was necessary to forget, then to draw it back into memory again at the moment when it was needed, and then promptly to forget it again: and above all, to apply the same process to the process itself -- that was the ultimate subtlety: consciously to induce unconsciousness, and then, once again, to become unconscious of the act of hypnosis you had just performed. Even to understand the word 'doublethink' involved the use of doublethink.
truth.author: George Orwell

truth.quote: I was very afraid at the beginning, until Master told me that pain isn't the truth; it's what you have to get through in order to find the truth.
truth.author: Deepak Chopra

truth.quote: Do you know what you're saying when you say, "Whatever"? It's just a code word for the f-word, followed by "you." And at your age, you never, ever. say that to anyone.' " Blaze leaned back. "So now, when someone says it to me, I just say, 'You too.' (72)
truth.author: Nicholas Sparks

truth.quote: Falsehood is never in words; it is in things.
truth.author: Italo Calvino

truth.quote: We're called to be faithful, to take those first difficult steps--and to leave the results up to God.
truth.author: Alex  Harris

truth.quote: My choice of Muhammad to lead the list of the world's most influential persons may surprise some readers and may be questioned by others, but he was the only man in history who was supremely successful on both the religious and secular level.
truth.author: Michael H. Hart

truth.quote: Anyone who doesn't take truth seriously in small matters cannot be trusted in large ones either.
truth.author: Albert Einstein

truth.quote: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
truth.author: Kahlil Gibran

truth.quote: To make a true choice, we must have true knowledge.
truth.author: Cassandra Clare

truth.quote: I felt lonely and content at the same time. I believe that is a rare kind of happiness.
truth.author: Stephen King

truth.quote: There were a hundred shades between a truth and lie, and she knew them all.
truth.author: V.E. Schwab

truth.quote: Interviewer: Didn't Sagan want to believe?Druyan: he didn't want to believe. he wanted to know.
truth.author: Ann Druyan

truth.quote: Man is a clever animal who behaves like an imbecile.
truth.author: Albert Schweitzer

truth.quote: The truth of the story lies in the details.
truth.author: Paul Auster

truth.quote: Crying can bring relief, as long as you don't cry alone.
truth.author: Anne Frank

truth.quote: To force oneself to believe and to accept a thing without understanding is political, and not spiritual or intellectual.
truth.author: Siddhārtha Gautama

truth.quote: People aren't born sad; we make them that way.
truth.author: Nikita Gill

truth.quote: When you hate someone you used to love, and you think he's done something awful - he probably has.
truth.author: E. Lockhart

truth.quote: You are the Truth from foot to brow. Now, what else would you like to know?
truth.author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

truth.quote: The truth always carries the ambiguity of the words used to express it.
truth.author: Frank Herbert

truth.quote: Knowing it and seeing it are two different things.
truth.author: Suzanne Collins

truth.quote: I'm living at a peak of clarity and beauty I never knew existed. Every part of me is attuned to the work. I soak it up into my pores during the day, and at night—in the moments before I pass off into sleep—ideas explode into my head like fireworks. There is no greater joy than the burst of solution to a problem. Incredible that anything could happen to take away this bubbling energy, the zest that fills everything I do. It's as if all the knowledge I've soaked in during the past months has coalesced and lifted me to a peak of light and understanding. This is beauty, love, and truth all rolled into one. This is joy.
truth.author: Daniel Keyes

truth.quote: The best gifts come from the heart, not the store.
truth.author: Sarah Dessen

truth.quote: From the mouths of the innocents flows truth.
truth.author: Rae Carson

truth.quote: Speak the truth do not become angered and give when asked, even be it a little. By these three conditions one goes to the presence of the gods.
truth.author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

truth.quote: In darkness God's truth shines most clear.
truth.author: Corrie Ten Boom

truth.quote: Never apologize for showing your feelings. When you do, you are apologizing for the truth.
truth.author: José N. Harris

truth.quote: Occasionally he stumbled over the truth, but hastily picked himself up and hurried on as if nothing had happened.
truth.author: Winston Churchill

truth.quote: To love is easy, to be in a relationship is extremely difficult.
truth.author: Santosh Kalwar

truth.quote: I believe in God but people are liars. It's those people who say they are appointed by God who I don't believe in.
truth.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

truth.quote: The truth is like salt. Men want to taste a little, but too much makes everyone sick.
truth.author: Joe Abercrombie

truth.quote: Hell is truth seen too late.
truth.author: Thomas Hobbes

truth.quote: Death is unstoppable. One must face it as a fact of life
truth.author: D. Aswini

truth.quote: How would your life be different if…You approached all relationships with authenticity and honesty? Let today be the day…You dedicate yourself to building relationships on the solid foundation of truth and authenticity.
truth.author: Steve Maraboli

truth.quote: I loved him.I couldn't pinpoint what made me so certain, but I knew it then, as surely as I knew my name or the color of the sky or any fact written in a book.Could he feel it, too?Maxon broke the kiss and looked at me. "You're so pretty when you are a mess."I laughed nervously. "Thank you. For that and for the rain and for not giving up."He ran his fingers along my cheek and nose and chin. "You're worth it. I don't think that you get that. You're worth it to me.
truth.author: Kiera Cass

truth.quote: The significance of our lives and our fragile planet is then determined only by our own wisdom and courage. We are the custodians of life's meaning. We long for a Parent to care for us, to forgive us our errors, to save us from our childish mistakes. But knowledge is preferable to ignorance. Better by far to embrace the hard truth than a reassuring fable. If we crave some cosmic purpose, then let us find ourselves a worthy goal.
truth.author: Carl Sagan

truth.quote: The truth is like a lion; you don’t have to defend it. Let it loose; it will defend itself.
truth.author: Augustine of Hippo

truth.quote: We all know that any emotional bias -- irrespective of truth or falsity -- can be implanted by suggestion in the emotions of the young, hence the inherited traditions of an orthodox community are absolutely without evidential value.... If religion were true, its followers would not try to bludgeon their young into an artificial conformity; but would merely insist on their unbending quest for truth, irrespective of artificial backgrounds or practical consequences. With such an honest and inflexible openness to evidence, they could not fail to receive any real truth which might be manifesting itself around them. The fact that religionists do not follow this honourable course, but cheat at their game by invoking juvenile quasi-hypnosis, is enough to destroy their pretensions in my eyes even if their absurdity were not manifest in every other direction.
truth.author: H.P. Lovecraft

truth.quote: Knowing the truth is not always a kindness.
truth.author: Rosamund Hodge

truth.quote: Whether a thought is spoken or not it is a real thing and it has power," Tuek said. "You might find the line between life and death among the Fremen to be too sharp and quick.
truth.author: Frank Herbert

truth.quote: Truth is so obscure in these times, and falsehood so established, that, unless we love the truth, we cannot know it.
truth.author: Blaise Pascal

truth.quote: It's a funny thing about life, once you begin to take note of the things you are grateful for, you begin to lose sight of the things that you lack.
truth.author: Germany Kent

truth.quote: Whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.
truth.author: Anonymous

truth.quote: She cracked a smile. "So what's your poison?" He sighed dramatically, and let the truth tumble off his tongue. "Life." "Ah," she said ruefully. "That'll kill you.
truth.author: Victoria Schwab

truth.quote: Never say that you can't do something, or that something seems impossible, or that something can't be done, no matter how discouraging or harrowing it may be; human beings are limited only by what we allow ourselves to be limited by: our own minds. We are each the masters of our own reality; when we become self-aware to this: absolutely anything in the world is possible.Master yourself, and become king of the world around you. Let no odds, chastisement, exile, doubt, fear, or ANY mental virii prevent you from accomplishing your dreams. Never be a victim of life; be it's conqueror.
truth.author: Mike  Norton

truth.quote: Look, it's easy to outsmart a werewolf or a vampire," Jace said. "They're no smarter than anyone else. But faeries live for hundreds of years and they're as cunning as snakes. They can't lie, but they love to engage in creative truth-telling. They'll find out whatever it is you want most in the world and give it to you—with a sting in the tail of the gift that will make you regret you ever wanted it in the first place." He sighed. "They're not really about helping people. More about harm disguised as help.
truth.author: Cassandra Clare

truth.quote: Many things that are true feel like a cheat. Kingdoms get the princes they deserve, farmers’ daughters die for no reason, and sometimes witches merit saving. Quite often, actually. You’d be surprised.
truth.author: Patrick Ness

truth.quote: Because I trust in the ever-changing climate of the heart. (At least, today I feel that way.) I think it is necessary to have many experiences for the sake of feeling something; for the sake of being challenged, and for the sake of being expressive, to offer something to someone else, to learn what we are capable of.
truth.author: Jason Mraz

truth.quote: Lying is easy. But it's lonely."What do you mean?"When you lie to everyone about everything, what's left? What's true?"Nothing," I say."Exactly.
truth.author: Victoria Schwab

truth.quote: Somebody knows.
truth.author: Ally Carter

truth.quote: I think, that if the world were a bit more like ComicCon, it would be a better place.
truth.author: Matt Smith

truth.quote: True love is not a hide and seek game: in true love, both lovers seek each other.
truth.author: Michael Bassey Johnson

truth.quote: Truth is ever to be found in the simplicity, and not in the multiplicity and confusion of things.
truth.author: Isaac Newton

truth.quote: There are many things in your heart you can never tell to another person. They are you, your private joys and sorrows, and you can never tell them. You cheapen yourself, the inside of yourself, when you tell them.
truth.author: Greta Garbo

truth.quote: When everything gets answered, it's fake.
truth.author: Sean Penn

truth.quote: The single best thing about coming out of the closet is that nobody can insult you by telling you what you've just told them.
truth.author: Rachel Maddow

truth.quote: No one believes a liar. Even when she's telling the truth.
truth.author: Sara Shepard

truth.quote: Your truest friends are the ones who will stand by you in your darkest moments--because they're willing to brave the shadows with you--and in your greatest moments--because they're not afraid to let you shine.
truth.author: Nicole Yatsonsky

truth.quote: Maybe you could be mine / or maybe we’ll be entwined / aimless in this sexless foreplay.
truth.author: Jess C Scott

truth.quote: Nothing is yet in its true form.
truth.author: C.S. Lewis

truth.quote: To see what is in front of one’s nose needs a constant struggle.
truth.author: George Orwell

truth.quote: In the calculus of feelings, you never really know how one person's absence will affect you more than another's.
truth.author: Gayle Forman

truth.quote: The truth is always an abyss. One must — as in a swimming pool — dare to dive from the quivering springboard of trivial everyday experience and sink into the depths, in order to later rise again — laughing and fighting for breath — to the now doubly illuminated surface of things.
truth.author: Franz Kafka

truth.quote: Only the hand that erases can write the true thing.
truth.author: Meister Eckhart

truth.quote: When men are pure, laws are useless; when men are corrupt, laws are broken.
truth.author: Benjamin Disraeli

truth.quote: Show me a woman who doesn't feel guilty and I'll show you a man.
truth.author: erica jong

truth.quote: How 'bout a shot of truth in that denial cocktail.
truth.author: Jennifer Salaiz

truth.quote: Before you enbark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
truth.author: Sara Shepard

truth.quote: Every decent con man knows that the simplest truth is more powerful than even the most elaborate lie.
truth.author: Ally Carter

truth.quote: Accepting the facts is always tough, so we search for forgiveness to this universe everyday to break the shackles, hurt is a prison and I from a very young young age refused to be held prisoner or even conform.
truth.author: Aidan McNally

truth.quote: The unqualified truth is, that when I loved Estella with the love of a man, I loved her simply because I found her irresistible. Once for all; I knew to my sorrow, often and often, if not always, that I loved her against reason, against promise, against peace, against hope, against happiness, against all discouragement that could be. Once for all; I love her none the less because I knew it, and it had no more influence in restraining me, than if I had devoutly believed her to be human perfection .
truth.author: Charles Dickens

truth.quote: I am a lover of truth, a worshiper of freedom, a celebrant at the altar of language and purity and tolerance.
truth.author: Stephen Fry

truth.quote: Truth does not become more true by virtue of the fact that the entire world agrees with it, nor less so even if the whole world disagrees with it.
truth.author: Maimonides

truth.quote: I realized when you look at your mother, you are looking at the purest love you will ever know.
truth.author: Mitch Albom

truth.quote: Love doesn't always come when you want it to. Sometimes it just happens, despite your will.
truth.author: V.C. Andrews

truth.quote: Great is truth, but still greater, from a practical point of view, is silence about truth.
truth.author: Aldous Huxley

truth.quote: Each time we don't say what we wanna say, we're dying.
truth.author: Yoko Ono

truth.quote: Some things aren't meant to be known. Only believed.
truth.author: Mary E. Pearson

truth.quote: the worst part about being lied to is knowing you werent worth the truth
truth.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

truth.quote: Don’t spoil me with your lies, love me with your truth.
truth.author: T.F. Hodge

truth.quote: It is a fool's prerogative to utter truths that no one else will speak.
truth.author: Neil Gaiman

truth.quote: El que lee mucho y anda mucho, ve mucho y sabe mucho.
truth.author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

truth.quote: True friends will always push you towards the great possibilities of your future, false friends will always chain you to the mistakes in your past.
truth.author: Seth Brown

truth.quote: Our society is run by insane people for insane objectives
truth.author: John Lennon

truth.quote: It's not about going around trying to stir up trouble. As long as you're honest and you articulate what you believe to be true, somebody somewhere will become your enemy whether you like it or not.
truth.author: Criss Jami

truth.quote: The most confused you will ever get is when you try to convince your heart and spirit of something your mind knows is a lie.
truth.author: Shannon L. Alder

truth.quote: One of the greatest journeys in life is overcoming insecurity and learning to truly not give a shit.
truth.author: J. A. Konrath

truth.quote: My bullshit meter is reading that as 'false'.
truth.author: Charlaine Harris

truth.quote: Lies are neither bad nor good. Like a fire they can either keep you warm or burn you to death, depending on how they're used.
truth.author: Max Brooks

truth.quote: Belief can be manipulated. Only knowledge is dangerous.
truth.author: Frank Herbert

truth.quote: The worst thing you can do if you miss or need someone is let them know it.
truth.author: Sarah Dessen

truth.quote: Truth is a matter of the imagination.
truth.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

truth.quote: A boy may be as disagreeable as he pleases, but when a girl refuses to crap sunshine on command, the world mutters darkly about her moods.
truth.author: Scott Lynch

truth.quote: Children know perfectly well that unicorns aren’t real, but they also know that books about unicorns, if they are good books, are true books.
truth.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

truth.quote: The pre-Socratic Greek philosopher Parmenides taught that the only things that are real are things which never change... and the pre-Socratic Greek philosopher Heraclitus taught that everything changes. If you superimpose their two views, you get this result: Nothing is real.
truth.author: Philip K. Dick

truth.quote: Girls get screwed.Not that kind of screwed, what I mean is, they're always on the short end of things.The way things work, how guys feel great, but make girls feelcheap for doingexactly what they beg for.The way they get to play you, all the while claiming they love you and making you believe it's true.The way it's okay to gift their heart one day, a backhand the next, to move on to the apricotwhen the peach blushes and bruises.These things make me believe God's a man after all.
truth.author: Ellen  Hopkins

truth.quote: Destiny is real. And she's not mild-mannered. She will come around and hit you in the face and knock you over and before you know what hit you, you're naked- stripped of everything you thought you knew and everything you thought you didn't know- and there you are! A bloody nose, bruises all over you, and naked. And it's the most beautiful thing.
truth.author: C. JoyBell C.

truth.quote: What would happen if one woman told the truth about her life?The world would split open.
truth.author: Muriel Rukeyser

truth.quote: A painting is more than the sum of its parts,' he would tell me, and then go on to explain how the cow by itself is just a cow, and the meadow by itself is just grass and flowers, and the sun peeking through the trees is just a beam of light, but put them all together and you've got magic.
truth.author: Wendelin Van Draanen

truth.quote: It's easy to look back and see it, and it's easy to give the advice. But the sad fact is, most people don't look beneath the surface until it's too late.
truth.author: Wendelin Van Draanen

truth.quote: A lie can run round the world before the truth has got its boots on.
truth.author: Terry Pratchett

truth.quote: Say not, "I have found the truth," but rather, "I have found a truth."Say not, "I have found the path of the soul." Say rather, "I have met the soul walking upon my path."For the soul walks upon all paths.The soul walks not upon a line, neither does it grow like a reed.The soul unfolds itself, like a lotus of countless petals.
truth.author: Kahlil Gibran

truth.quote: Sometimes I go to God and say, "God, if Thou dost never answer another prayer while I live on this earth, I will still worship Thee as long as I live and in the ages to come for what Thou hast done already. God’s already put me so far in debt that if I were to live one million millenniums I couldn’t pay Him for what He’s done for me.
truth.author: A.W. Tozer

truth.quote: I told him I was going to betray you, and betray Lyra, and he believed me because I was corrupt and full of wickedness; he looked so deep I felt sure he'd see the truth. But I lied too well. I was lying with every nerve and fiber and everything I'd ever done...I wanted him to find no good in me, and he didn't. There is none.
truth.author: Philip Pullman

truth.quote: If it can be destroyed by the truth, it deserves to be destroyed by the truth.
truth.author: Carl Sagan

truth.quote: the wounded child inside many males is a boy who, when he first spoke his truths, was silenced by paternal sadism, by a patriarchal world that did not want him to claim his true feelings. The wounded child inside many females is a girl who was taught from early childhood that she must become something other than herself, deny her true feelings, in order to attract and please others. When men and women punish each other for truth telling, we reinforce the notion that lies are better. To be loving we willingly hear the other’s truth, and most important, we affirm the value of truth telling. Lies may make people feel better, but they do not help them to know love.
truth.author: bell hooks

truth.quote: It’s as simple as that. Simple and complicated, as most true things are.
truth.author: David Levithan

truth.quote: In the end, Leck should have stuck to his lies. For it was the truth he almost told that killed him.
truth.author: Kristin Cashore

truth.quote: Each star is a mirror reflecting the truth inside you.
truth.author: Aberjhani

truth.quote: regret is mostly caused by not havingdone anything.
truth.author: Charles Bukowski

truth.quote: You can resolve to live your life with integrity. Let your credo be this: Let the lie come into the world, let it even triumph. But not through me.
truth.author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

truth.quote: I was in my bed trying to figure out why sometimes you can wake up and go back to sleep and other times you can't
truth.author: Stephen Chbosky

truth.quote: Procrastination is not the problem. It is the solution. It is the universe's way of saying stop, slow down, you move too fast. Listen to the music. Whoa whoa, listen to the music. Because music makes the people come together, it makes the bourgeois and the rebel. So come on people now, smile on your brother, everybody try to love one another.
